TopicTitle: Better Part Highlighting and Feedback in Assembly Buildings

Articles.Content:
Hello! Didn't have a reason to make an acc here before, but after trying to find a thread regarding this point (without luck) gave me a chance to open an acc up and boot this discussion out.

I'm not new to KSP, been playing over 6 months, so this is something that kept bugging me the most:

Part highlighting is very inconsistent. I do understand that the future plans are to make some kind of a better system for stage setups (something along the lines of a schematic type setup?), which would be very desirable and make everything easier to follow.

It's not a big issue on smaller ships/setups, but once you set something complicated up, parts get covered and you can't figure out what are you looking at in the stagings on the right, and where it is on the ship. Sometimes, an entire section gets highlighted to denote that it will be decoupled, but sometimes, only the decoupler gets highlighted disregarding the rest of the attached items.

It would be nicer if parts could get highlighted brighter, just a bit more, and show transparent, in case there's tons of stuff covering an item to be able to set up stages with less guessing. Action Groups window helps a little, but there's still the issue of fishing the items out from the deep.

I was wondering what are your thoughts on this? Have you had cumbersome experiences whilst building comlicated vehicles/rockets? Don't take everything I wrote as a complaint, just had to point out the exact issue and get some opinions and info on this.

Love this game to bits for what it provides tho. :} Tons of fun.

I agree a lot could be done to improve the Assembly Building GUI and feedback. Higher contrast highlights would be a good start, and a clearer representation how how parts are being staged would save time.

I doubt saving time is the highest priority in KSP.. :} One day, I managed to spend about 6 hours real time to carry out a single mission (and sort out some complications during) .

Construction could be made less cumbersome and fed back better than what it is now. Pretty sure Squad has something up their sleeves and I'm anxiously waiting for each new update. :}

Spent plenty of time on various missions in KSP myself. I don't consider the time I waste fighting with the UI time well spent though. I'd rather be spending more time designing and flying (and blowing up).
